results.name: Convolution triangle, read by rows, where diagonals are successive self-convolutions of A118346.
comment: A118346 equals the central terms of pendular triangle A118345 and the diagonals of this triangle form the semi-diagonals of the triangle A118345.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..50 of the triangle, flattened
formula: Since g.f. G=G(x) of A118346 satisfies: G = 1 - 2*x*G + 2*x*G^2 + x*G^3 then T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) - 2*T(n-1,k-1) + 2*T(n,k-1) + T(n+1,k-1). Also, a recurrence involving antidiagonals is: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + Sum_{j=1..k} [3*T(n-1+j,k-j) - 2*T(n-2+j,k-j)] for n>k>=0.
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021 *)
program: else: return T(n-1, k) -2*T(n-1, k-1) +2*T(n, k-1) +T(n+1, k-1)
flatten([[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 17 2021
